title: Which countries are on the North American continent? - Quora

response.answer_text: In North America, population 579 million, there are 23 officially recognized independent states. The largest of them is Canada, followed by also rather big the United States, these two giants together occupy more than 79% of the whole continent area. The smallest country in this part of the world is Saint Kitts and Nevis, it is only two small islands in the Caribbean.  List of countries in North America There is some confusion with Central America, which is the southernmost, isthmian portion of North American. Some people class Central America as being NOT a part of North America, even though it is, under many classifications. Another site shows: North America Countries This list does not include the island dependencies and overseas territories in the Caribbean. Antigua and BarbudaBahamasBarbadosBelizeCanadaCosta RicaCubaDominicaDominican RepublicEl SalvadorGrenadaGuatemalaHaitiHondurasJamaicaMexicoNicaraguaPanamaSaint Kitts and NevisSaint LuciaSaint Vincent and the GrenadinesTrinidad and TobagoUnited Statesand

Originally Answered: “Is it true that North America has 23 countries?” It’s true. And by “countries” I mean sovereign independent states. North America also consists of the isthmian region of Central America and another 22 island territories in the Caribbean, including Aruba, Puerto Rico and the US Virgin Islands. In alphabetical order: Antigua and Barbuda(The) BahamasBarbadosBelizeCanadaCosta RicaCubaDominicaDominican RepublicEl SalvadorGrenadaGuatemalaHaitiHondurasJamaicaMexicoNicaraguaPanamaSaint Kitts and NevisSaint LuciaSaint Vincent and the GrenadinesTrinidad and TobagoUnited States of AmericaNorth America
